member.name: ITfContextView.GetRangeFromPoint
member.summary: The ITfContextView.GetRangeFromPoint method converts a point, in screen coordinates, to an empty range of text positioned at a corresponding location.
member.param: Specifies the edit cookie with read-only access.
Specifies the point in screen coordinates.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: Specifies the range position to return based upon the screen coordinates of the point to a character bounding box. By default, the range position returned is the character bounding box containing the screen coordinates of the point. If the point is outside a character bounding box, the method returns NULL or TF_E_INVALIDPOINT. Other bit flags for this parameter are as follows.
The bit flags can be combined.

listheader.description: If the screen coordinates of the point are contained in a character bounding box, the range position returned is the bounding edge closest to the screen coordinates of the point.
If the screen coordinates of the point are not contained in a character bounding box, the closest range position is returned.

member.param: Receives a pointer to the ITfRange interface.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: The pptScreen parameter does not cover any document text.
The application has not calculated a text layout.
The specified edit cookie is invalid.

member.name: ITfContextView.GetScreenExt
member.summary: The ITfContextView.GetScreenExt method returns the bounding box, in screen coordinates, of the document display.
member.param: Receives the bounding box, in screen coordinates, of the display surface.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

member.name: ITfContextView.GetTextExt
member.summary: The ITfContextView.GetTextExt method returns the bounding box, in screen coordinates, of a range of text.
member.param: Specifies an edit cookie with read-only access.
Receives the bounding box, in screen coordinates, of the range.

Receives the Boolean value that specifies if the text in the bounding box has been clipped. If this parameter is TRUE, the bounding box contains clipped text and does not include the entire requested range. The bounding box is clipped because of the requested range is not visible.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: The text is not rendered or the context has not calculated the text layout.
The edit cookie parameter is invalid.

member.name: ITfContextView
member.summary: The ITfContextView interface is implemented by the TSF manager and used by a client (application or text service) to obtain information about a context view. Clients obtain this interface by calling the method which returns a pointer to the ITfContextView object.
